alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 12:53PM CDT until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Chambers, Harris, Liberty and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may be impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas has occurred. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1251 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, causing minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will slow the decrease of any existing flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Pasadena, Baytown, Deer Park, Humble, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Cloverleaf, Channelview, Barrett, Highlands, Greater Fifth Ward, Kingwood, Aldine, Near Northside Houston, Northside / Northline, Second Ward, Downtown Houston, Greater Heights, Greater Greenspoint and northern Memorial Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
